mixed-citation.article-title: Hydroids (Cnidaria, Hydrozoa) from the Vema and Valdivia seamounts (SE Atlantic)

tp:treatment-sec.p: Clytia gracilis – Ramil & Vervoort 1992: 235–238 , fig. 67a. — Cornelius 1995: 246–248 , fig. 56.

p.tp:material-citation: SOUTH ATLANTIC OCEAN • 1 colony , growing on Campanularia hincksii , without gonothecae; Vema Seamount , stn Dive 3; 71–935 m depth; 31 Jan. 2015 ; SEAFO-2015 leg.; SEAFO-2015-40132.

tp:treatment-sec.p: Clytia gracilis is a circumglobal species in temperate and tropical waters, widely distributed in the East Atlantic, from England to South Africa (Gil 2017). Its bathymetric distribution ranges from 0 ( Peña Cantero & García Carrascosa 2002 ) to 1443 m ( Schuchert 2001a ).
